website_summaries.verdict: Easy to grip and long enough to power through over-tightened nuts. This bar is good for DIYers who need it occasionally.
pros: Rugged design with plenty of leverage for lightweight jobs
Grip is smooth but comfortable in the hand
cons: Molybdenum head may not be as sturdy as the bar itself
Shaft may warp after several uses

customer_reviews.title: No Replacement for Length!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure any other tool in my arsenal puts a smile on my face when I get to use it... This one does. It is extremely well built, and verging on hilariously long at nearly 40". THE tool to have if you are removing the Jesus nut on axles/hubs/wheel bearings/etc. 15 year old nuts torqued to 250lbft at the factory are loosened with hardly any effort. No heat. No PB Blaster. Just some good ole' T=r x F. I wish there were more excuses to use it. Perhaps if you are a heavy equipment mechanic but not for a lowly DIYer. Other possible uses include: - Reloading civil war reenactment cannons - Billiards cue
customer_reviews.author: M Cocola

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for money
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for money. A tool I wouldn't buy at the Snap On price, but a valuable addition to my farm tool kit. UPDATE, I just used this tool on a very difficult job. I even abused it to get the job done and it held up beyond my expectations. I was about to resort to taking it to a shop or torching it off, but this breaker bar saved me more time trouble effort and MONEY that I paid for it. Can't say enough good.
customer_reviews.author: Mae B Wright

customer_reviews.title: Super Quilty and Strength
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those tools you may not need often, but when you do it is well worth the purchase. I was afraid when I ordered this that it might not be high quality, However I was wrong. It has a quality finished and super strong. As I have aged, I do not have the strength and need extra leverage to loosen and tighten bolts on farm implements. They are usually rusted and may have not been turned in years. This unit does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin Bass

customer_reviews.title: The little tool that could.
customer_reviews.text: Say hello to my little friend. I love this guy. It helps loosen bolts in tight areas. It has a nice weight to it, and it can take a lot of torque. Also, the costumer support, oh my god is it good. I broke mine trying to loosen up some nuts off a wheel (guys at the shop torqued them nuts way too hard. It only broke because I used a metal tube over the breaker lol). I send an email explaining what happened. A week later my replacement arrived. I definitely recommend this product. If you don't like this product, then I recommend Tekton's costumer support. If you don't like the costumer support, please visit your local psychiatrist
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to break loose the retaining bolts on my front brake calipers, and glad I'm I did. I tried to break them loose with my standard wrench with no luck. Combined this with Tekton deep socket set, and found it ridiculously easy to brake seal in seconds. What I especially loved is the pivoting head, which allowed me to gain leverage to force the bolt loose. Without it, I wouldn't have been able to work around the brake line and wheel well. I also used this in conjunction with a digital torque adapter to effectively turn it into a poor man's torque wrench. Worked like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: B. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Breaker Bar is the Real Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Used this breaker bar to remove some 42mm nuts on a 7-foot rotary cutter. The nuts hold the heavy blades that the cutter uses to cut pastures while attached to my tractor. Before buying this breaker bar, I was concerned that I would need to use an impact wrench and air compressor to remove the nuts. However, with this long breaker bar, the nuts came off easily! I know that the nuts were factory tight because cotter pins are used to keep the nuts from backing out. Actually, removing the cotter pins between the nuts and the long bolts were the toughest part of this task. So removing factory tight bolts without and impact wrench? This bar is great!
customer_reviews.author: M. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: It held up!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 24' breaker bar to remove the crank bolt off my 2015 Accord v6. With a 5ft cheater pipe and me hanging off the end of it (literally, all 190lbs of me), it flexed to the point that I just knew it was going to snap in half...but it didn't! I had to do this several times, heating the bolt between tries. On the last try was a nearly deafening POP...I though the breaker bar was done. But, I was wrong, the bolt had finally come loose! The breaker bar did it's job! Mine came in perfect condition, head was tight on the shaft with no gaps. Worked perfect when I needed it the most.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dub

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good tool
customer_reviews.text: This (#15353) is apparently the newer version of Tekton's breaker bar. The old one (#1695) has a shiny head made from Chrome Vanadium, where this one has a black head made from Chrome Moly. Generally speaking Cr-Mo is better than Cr-V. It is stronger and less brittle, and usually seen on more expensive tools. So it is a slight upgrade from the older model. Anyway the tolerances seem a bit loose on this breaker bar, but it has worked well for me so far. I have always found Tekton tools to be a pretty good value for your money. The good thing about buying cheap tools: use them twice and you already feel like you have got your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: haggis

customer_reviews.title: The Tekton #15355 is a really nice breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: The Tekton #15355 is a really nice breaker bar! I used it in combination with a Tekton #14272 1/2 x 3/8 reducer to break free difficult spark plugs on my 2003 Ranger. Two plugs on the passenger side are extremely hard to get leverage on and to make them even harder to loosen, they had been installed with no apparent anti- seize. I also used both both Tekton tools to break free my O2 sensor in combination with a Tekton #47749 O2 Sensor Socket and after soaking the sensor's threads with rust penetrator, all three Tekton tools made removal of the sensor very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in re-doing the suspension, axles, lower arms, ball joints and the rest of my lower front end and I am very pleased. A lot of my front end was full of rusted seized bolts that I was considering cutting off. I went this route instead and bought this breaker bar. I had put a lot of torque on some of these nuts and this bar made the job go smoother and easier. I DO recommend this Beaker Bar! also couldn't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: PBrady

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Strong. Well made. Love the length.
customer_reviews.text: Hit a wonderful New England pothole and punctured a tire. Pulled out the jack and the so called lug wrench and proceeded to not be able to loosen the lugs. Absolutely no leverage with the provided wrench. Bought this bad boy in case (ha, when next) I need to do that tire change yet again. Long, heavy, sturdy and well made. Like it. Will also make a great weapon in a a pinch. Impressed with Tekton and happy I ook the chance on their tools.
customer_reviews.author: Paying Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable addition to the arsenal.
customer_reviews.text: Not a whole lot going on here - this is a solid, simple tool that appears to be made well and that comes at an affordable price for a auto DIY-er like me. I needed some extra leverage for suspension work and this breaker bar did the trick. Cam bolts/pinch bolts were no problem, and I appreciated that breaking lugs loose was easier than with my 18-in breaker, too. I can't evaluate this from a pro's perspective but it sure seems like a good deal for the weekend garage warriors out there.
customer_reviews.author: AlBSure

customer_reviews.title: Excellent breaker bar!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this for a possibility of needing extra leverage to unbolt the downpipe to turbo on my '13 WRX but ended up not using it (since ATF & acetone 50/50 mix did an awesome job for penetration oil). But also the bar made it easier to loosen the lug nuts. I generally loosen them with the breaker bar for ease, use my cheap Dewalt drill to unscrew (and screw) then use TEKTON 24335 torque wrench to finish the job. It's a solid piece of metal. No flex and gets the job done. I guess if anything I'll probably wrap the handle with some tennis racket grip (which I've done with my pedal bike) for some grip.
customer_reviews.author: AkiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy
customer_reviews.text: Going on a year now with this. While the breaker bar does give some extra leverage, the rotating joint is far too loose and borderline unsafe at the loads we require for a breaker bar. I have about 25 degrees of slop from end to end or 10-15 degrees of takeup before I'm even loading the fastener. This has caused wrenches and crows feet to slip off their fasteners damaging nearby surfaces, and, occasionally, an elbow or knuckle depending on where I am. Another reviewer mentioned possibly adding a washer or two to help tighten things up - I'll update after trying that! Otherwise it's time for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: snapped at hinge when try ing to remove hub bolt from front hub axle :( UPDATE: i added star because the guy at TEKTON offered to help, albiet i have moved on since. Still she broke doing what i thought was normal for her to do. Use 1" drive? huh? i might as well take it to shop then. I did spend money on a cheap 1/2 impact wrench (my new toy - 'freight') that fit the 23mm (hub) socket i had bought, that did the job just fine. (still dont get the 1" drive suggestion)
customer_reviews.author: Ody

customer_reviews.title: It's a bar of metal.
customer_reviews.text: The breaker bar works as expected, but don't fall for Amazon's 'frequently bought together' combination w/ Tekton's adapter set. If you need an adapter, don't buy Tekton #4957. The reason is that model #4957 is meant for impact drivers (not hand tools). The metallurgial composition of the alloy for impact sockets/adapters are much different than what is required for hand tools. This breaker bar will shear that adapter on first use.
customer_reviews.author: gshoes

customer_reviews.title: Hot Water Tank
customer_reviews.text: Gas-fired hot water tanks have an anode rod whose sole purpose is to increase the life of the water tank. The rod does this by sacrificing itself, by either giving up its metal or acquiring a coating, rather than having the tank lining suffer. These approximately one-inch diameter, 3 to 4 foot long rods are all topped by a 1 and 1/16 inch nut. Anode rods should be replaced every 3 to 5 years. To best utilise this socket, use a Wera Zyklop hex head 1-1/16 inch socket .
customer_reviews.author: Barney

customer_reviews.title: Seldom used, always needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, nicely machined breaker bar. I sincerely doubt I'll use it more than 5 times over the next 40 years... but that's EXACTLY why I bought it... cause I simply MIGHT need it someday! :) Anyway, I'm a big believer in getting the best tool possible BEFORE I need it. As such, just having it means I'm less likely to ever need it. Either way, it's money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-K

customer_reviews.title: It looks pretty in my tool box
customer_reviews.text: I have the 12 inch version. There is a fair bit of side to side play in the head. This means you can never get a good angle to a fastener. It also makes it feel flimsy. I've generally found it to be not that great at breaking loose difficult fasteners. The finish is nice though. It looks pretty in my toolbox. It stays that way because I've stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Hooliator

customer_reviews.title: This is a keeper for DIY home mechanic
customer_reviews.text: This item saved me when I was trying to unscrew oil plug canistor nut that was very tight and could not set lose by my short wrench. I decided to use this breaker bar. It was heavy and long, sure, but.. The nut came loose very easy. I'm happy that my investment finally worth something decent. I'll keep this item.
customer_reviews.author: Moo

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size too
customer_reviews.text: As I've mentioned on my other reviews, Tekton is my new go to for tools. I have bought quite a few tools from this company now and they have all met and exceeded my expectations. They come with life time warranty and are made very well. The price is inexpensive compared to the U.S. name brands. I have done quite a few jobs with this breaker bars. It's the perfect size too, as I can store it in the back of my SUV. It has maintained its shape so far.
customer_reviews.author: icorona1015

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length for breaking any bolt that the breaker can reach. Much less force I have to put in than the ones we have at work because it's simple physics: the longer the arm the more torque you produce with the same input force. The only complaint I have, but it's not a big deal is that my bar came a little bent or curved. It's not very noticeable to the untrained eye, but I just wonder how a thick piece of steel got bent? I'd still buy again because the bar and head unit are solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I have this thing because I will no longer ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the boss of lug nut removals. I'm so glad I have this thing because I will no longer fear hurting myself trying to remove stubborn bolts. I removed over-torqued lug nuts today that were seemingly stuck on my car, and that a smaller breaker bar couldn't budge. This 40 inch breaker bar made it fun and easy to get them off. I'm keeping it in my car!
customer_reviews.author: rainor shine

customer_reviews.title: Bad Ass! Great price too
customer_reviews.text: Makes "breaking" the wheel nuts on my car a breeze without using any additional leverage. And the swivel head goes past 90 degrees so its great if you need tourque in tight places!! I have since bought multiple Tekton tools and haven't had a problem with any of them. To be fair, I am only a "Weekend Warrior" so I cant comment about how the tools would stand up to everyday professional use.
customer_reviews.author: J-Mack

customer_reviews.title: Great Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after nearly breaking my arms, legs, back, and nearly everything else loosening some really frozen bolts with a much smaller open wrench. Since then I've used this several times and really appreciate the leverage I can get with this. The only downside is that being as long as it is there will be a lot of bolts you just can't reach with it. The pivoting head does help with this though. This breaker bar has actually found its home in the trunk of my Mazda and I use it often for loosening the lug nuts since they often end up tighter than I can easily handle with the tire iron.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these are great tools from a great company.
customer_reviews.text: This brand is fantastic. I have sockets, bars, picks etc., and love the tools. They hold up, and have a fantastic warranty with top notch customer service. I personally haven't had to deal with CS, but from what I read, they are great. I will continue to buy tools from TEKTON because of this. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: BJM

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality tekton breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar is a beast I highly recommend it very sturdy and well built long enough to get a good grip for Max torque. I gave this and the TEKTON 4950 1/2-Inch Drive Lug Nut Service Tool Flip Impact Socket Set to my step dad for Father's day. We have used it already multiple times to remove lug nuts that were really tight had no prob removing them. As others have mentioned it does have a slight gap on the head of the bar but we had no prob with it.
customer_reviews.author: Julian z.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Breaker Bar for a Weekend Wrencher
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy Tekton brand tools so I figured I'd try their breaker bar and a couple different pliers. So far they've all worked exceptionally well and I have not had any issue with them quality wise. Are they Snap-On or Matco? No. But they're not trying to be either. If you need a specific tool and don't want to break the bank to buy it, Tekton is more then capable for the weekend wrencher.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Mostly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: While this breaker bar seems decent quality, all the pictures clearly show the end fitting precisely into the bar itself with no extra space. The bar I received has almost 1/8 inch of space. Everything feels pretty tight but it just seems unnecessary and makes it look sloppy. I haven’t used it yet so I can’t say if it effects the rigidity of the end piece but we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This breaker bar is a monster - You need this in your tool box
customer_reviews.text: Having the right tool for the job makes life so much easier. Everyone should have a giant breaker bar in their tool box for the bolts that are stuck. A 40 inch breaker bar can be used for the Jesus nut on a foreign car all of the way to a nut stuck on the tire of a large vehicle. This breaker bar is heavy and seems to be made well. I needed to break a stuck bolt lose on and axle and this bar did the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Sylvan BellTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: We broke two ratcheting sockets within a 10 minute period (one cheap, and one not so cheap), so I figured this might prevent further damage to my tool collection. Used it with a Torx head on a tight Jeep seat-belt bolt and it worked great. Super heavy and it feels very professional.
customer_reviews.author: The Merics

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I dont usually use Break bar, and I use A LOT OF FORCE to take out stuck bolts. After I get this thing, I use much less energy. Great product, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: t.s

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to break caliper bolts and hub lock nuts loose on buses that are torqued to over 900 ft lbs. with a 5’ cheater bar attached to it I’ve slightly bent the handle but never broke it! Tough as nails!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sells

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tool.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and high quality. Took off 20 lug nuts off with it and not a single problem. Amazon packaged the box in a way that there was a hole created due to the bar knocking back and fourth and I am glad it wasn't lost. Might have fallen out but maybe someone honest put it back in the box.... either way I wish someone was paying attention to packing my order but all was well at the end.
customer_reviews.author: BiGGiE

customer_reviews.title: Didn't feel like risking a 1/2 in bar after hearing they would ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed this mighty beast to take off a 2007 6.6 duramax harmonic balancer. Didn't feel like risking a 1/2 in bar after hearing they would bend or break. Even with this thing I had to pull hard (trying it with no cheater) but the bolt came off. This thing is weighty and massive. As a 6'3'' man I could use it as a golf club. I am impressed by the quality. I am sure it will come in handy for other projects with a reducer socket. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great Breaker Bar!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few TEKTON breaker bars and extra-long ratchets in my tool set and they all work very very well. I have applied a ton of torque to these wrenches and they hold up very well. They provide a great amount of extra leverage when working with large nuts and bolts or nuts and bolts that need some extra torque to break loose. I recommend these tools to everyone! They are very affordable and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ricks Munn

customer_reviews.title: Like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This was fantastic. Made it easy to get the tires off my car, along with the calipers. I changed my front brake pads and rotors and this just fit into the space needed. If I were doing the back brakes, I would also get a shorter breaker bar. The swivel head on this breaker bar was nice, and all me to fit it in some tight places.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: pain saver
customer_reviews.text: God this is SO helpful, those tight bolts are nothing now. It is so effortless to break bolts loose. I should have bought this earlier. And it doesn't feel cheap or anything, it actually feels sturdy and tough. I'd definitely recommend this :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality tool, provides enough leverage to break lug nuts, torqued to 550 lbs, loose.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to remove and re-tighten the lug nuts on my Volvo VNL 780 Semi tractor with this 3/4 drive breaker bar. The Lugs require 550 lbs of torque, I weigh 151 pounds, and am 5 foot 8 inches tall. This bar provided enough leverage for me to break them loose. Quality looks to be very good, I suspect that I will use this tool for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: M. Parr

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money...maybe great.
customer_reviews.text: Zero problems with this breaker bar. Nice length if you are working under the vehicle but don't want to jack it up too high. Much better leverage than a regular 3/8 socket, but not so long as to be ungainly. It worked well for my initial purpose, and should work well for me for a very long time. Of course, I'm a backyard mechanic, so my needs are modest. Perhaps it would not hold up to daily use...but then again, it might. For the price, I am extremely pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great breaker bar, would be nice if it was 12 inches
customer_reviews.text: This is a good breaker bar. It seems more than solid enough for any job requiring a 3/8 socket drive. I would not recommend trying to use this with any adapters to go up to 1/2 inch drive, more than likely it wouldn't handle that. But this is not what it's meant to do. Worked well for pulling my oil drain plug which is 14mm in size. The only thing that would make this better is the ability to accept a 3/8 socket extender at the end to lengthen the handle. Overall good quality, I would recommend this breaker bar for lighter work.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent break bar. I’ve never used one of these before and always relied on the crap tools that come with the spare tire kit. Well my current car came with crappy run flats so no tools. Using this break bar to loosen lug nuts is a dream.
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've also read some bad reviews about this as well but after using it it seems to work pretty good it seems solid and I think that with anything you really do get what you pay for dial brake bolts loose and it should do its job granted I haven't used it very long so if for some reason something happens I'll change my review
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 x 24 is loose fitting head : 3/8 x 11 better
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price (look at snap-on) but rather more play in the head than is reasonable. The pivot bolt isn't a close fit in the shaft, and side clearance head to shaft is big enough to need shimming. Tightening the bolt doesn't help. Wish it had a centre stop like the 3/8 one.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Burly
customer_reviews.text: I had to tighten the head a bit so that there was no free play on the axle, but otherwise this breaker bar is about the most breaker bar most people will need so long as they are not working on heavy trucks or equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Work in seconds, whereas before struggling an hour
customer_reviews.text: Troy Bilt tractor mower spindle/blade has a 1" nut that refuse to bulge with a 1-foot wrench. Literally sweated an hour using various methods. Put on the 1" nut onto this pretty chromed breaker bar, braze the blade from moving, put nut on, one twist and it was loosen, done. Need the right tool for the job and this breaker bar is it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ray Wu

customer_reviews.title: Cool Breaker Bar - 10/10 will impress Dad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this breaker bar for two reasons: 1. To use it for its intended purpose of loosening the nuts on my vehicle's tires. 2. To impress my father. Yes, my reasons were fulfilled. Very sturdy, easy to use, and will impress your Dad.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marble

customer_reviews.title: This breaker bar is fantastic! I replaced my rear shocks last weekend and ...
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar is fantastic! I replaced my rear shocks last weekend and my 24 inch breaker bar couldn't budge the top bolts. Immediately, this 40 inch breaker bar loosened the bolts. I thought I would only use this a couple times over the course of a year, but it has already saved me in two projects.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Kolar

customer_reviews.title: I use this for tightening the bolts on an Equal-i-zer ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for tightening the bolts on an Equal-i-zer hitch to 320 ft-lb along with a large torque wrench I have. This is the right tool for the job and it will not bend. I used a 1/2" breaker bar (with a pipe for an extension) and it got a bend in it.
customer_reviews.author: XMFJ4338

customer_reviews.title: Strong, high quality 3/4-inch breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: This is serious breaker bar. I love it! I had a wheel hub bolt on my 2009 VW GTI that I couldn't get free. I broke two other breaker bars that were puny compared to this one trying to remove the bolt. I had the stuck bolt free in a matter of seconds with this bar.
customer_reviews.author: Carlooch

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool.  Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This item worked well for me installing a trailer hitch. The bolts on my 13 year old Jeep were VERY tight. This got them off. These 12mm bolts were screwed into nuts welded to the frame (inaccessible). For one of them I needed to extend this to a 3ft breaker with a pipe. When pushed hard the bar flexed a lttle.I was afraid it would break. It didn't. Instead, the weld broke.
customer_reviews.author: ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this to remove the large axle nut on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to remove the large axle nut on the rear end of a VW bus. Very strong...had to use heat, stand on the edge of the bar and bounce to break the torque of the axle nut. Product is still in my toolbox ready for more action.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Great price and good build quality.
customer_reviews.text: The closest competitor is the Kobalt 3/8 drive breaker bar at Lowe's. I really just wanted to use this for replacing fan belts on Fords as they use 3/8" drive ratchets for most non-truck vehicles. That said, a ratchet is usually all I need, but extra leverage is always a good thing. I don't recommend this bar for a lot of torque, that's what a 1/2 drive is used for typically. Overall: 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: ChazTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I broke the 1/2 head clean off taking a lug nut off a dump trailer. Harbor freight bar still hasn't broke
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Tough enough!
customer_reviews.text: Much tougher than the photo appears. I have used it to break 3/4" mower deck-blade spindle bolts loose on a riding lawn mower. It probably took 200 foot pounds to break them loose. It required enough force to put an arc/bend in the breaker bar, and the breaker bar sprang right back in shape again.
customer_reviews.author: Walter E. Goddard

customer_reviews.title: but worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs a breaker bar in their toolbox. I worked on a bolt for hours using a wrench, heat and WD-40. Finally ordered a breaker bar off Amazon, and two days later when the breaker bar arrived I got that nasty bolt off. I did have to put a piece of pipe on the end to extend the leverage, but worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Top Dawg

customer_reviews.title: SOLID, STYLISH, AND FUNCTIONAL
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement for one I had in my toolbox that was stolen. This is longer, thicker, and stronger than the Craftsman I lost. Good tension on the spring loaded ball to hold a socket or extension. Good heavy, solid feel. Nice shiny chrome finish with a stylish look for a simple tool. A good investment for any toolbox that will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Burney Cain

customer_reviews.title: Brake job
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems removing my rear calipers on my truck, so I brought this 24”breaker bar. The bolt came loose with no problems. I ordered a shorter bars for my next projects
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool that works just like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Made easy work loosening the 19mm wheel lug nut bolts on my 2007 Honda Accord (that had not been loosened for 10K miles). Next up, a 17mm overtightened oil drain bolt was loosened with a near effortless quarter turn - while sitting to the side of the car. This is a solid tool with great leverage (and reach) that works just like it should.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Philpott

customer_reviews.title: Gread breaker bar for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to break some lug nuts loose that were on WAY too tight. This breaker bar flexed enough that the handle was curved, but it never broke. The lugs broke lose though. I'm sure I'll get many years of service from this breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: much higher quality than what youd' expect for it's cost.
customer_reviews.text: I've used it a few times but haven't put a lot of stress on it. Seems like it'll hold up though. It's heavy and well machined like something that should cost a lot more than it does. If it breaks or shows signs of fatigue, I will update my review but as of early on.. it's great
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Well made, took a fair amount of abuse too!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to help remove a stubborn mower deck mandrel screw that I could not get off even after using all kinds of lubricants to unstick it. It worked. Of course the lubricants may have just taken time to work too. But this is a nicely crafted tool that can take a fair amount of abuse. Will not hesitate to purchase more from Tekton.
customer_reviews.author: Geneva

customer_reviews.title: takes a licking & keeps on ticking (or something like that)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast that can take a LOT of torque. The only complaint anyone might have is that it's very heavy, but what should you expect for a 3/4 drive breaker bar that's this long? You need the beef to take the abuse. Put all the fanny you've got into it and it will ask for more. (and believe me, I've got fanny).
customer_reviews.author: Tony P.

customer_reviews.title: Breaker bar works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect length. I had tried to loosen a frozen lug nut with a 16” socket wrench to no avail. The extra length of this breaker bar really helped in loosening things.
customer_reviews.author: MDickson17

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I broke it today. Literally bent the housing around the head.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Tatman

customer_reviews.title: Stuck lug nuts no more
customer_reviews.text: Have a 2011 BMX X3 and two tire shops could not budge the lug nuts. Told me that I have to take to dealership. Ordered this breaker bar and right socket 11/16th from Tekton and in 5 minutes all lug nuts free. You got to be kidding me that tire shops can't do this with their torque guns! Ok I admit one nut I had to add a PVC cheater pipe for better leverage. It was that easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tools.
customer_reviews.text: Great! Use it everyday in my shop. Put it to the test everyday it never fails. Great craftsmanship. Use to by snap on tools. Believe TEKTON tools are just as good or better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Your not going to find a better breaker bar of this size for the price! Extremely durable, definitely over kill for the home mechanic!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Darrah

customer_reviews.title: Solid breaker bar.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after jury-rigging a cheater bar for months from an old aluminum pipe which was getting warped. So far it's been great for freeing all the rusted bolts in a project truck. I have been able to really torque on this thing and it doesn't feel like it's flexing or warping like some of the cheaper breaker bars can.
customer_reviews.author: J. Woody

customer_reviews.title: I needed something stronger m
customer_reviews.text: It will not handle heavy duty work .. I needed something stronger ... The neck is not that strong .. I returned it without using it
customer_reviews.author: Taha Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Easy 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to install new suspension in my car (6 years old). This broke every single nut and bolt loose without a hitch and without a sweat. All the leverage you will need with the fit and finish of any top end tool I've used. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sakie8015

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for the shop
customer_reviews.text: Wish I knew about this tool earlier. Very handy around the shop. Used to help revoke bolts from things such as my zero turn mower, boat and anything else that requires heavy duty torque. So much easier to remove bolts than conventional ratchet handles. No problem with bar after several months use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M

customer_reviews.title: Solid breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: Very solid breaker bar. High quality. Tekton makes great products and this breaker bar is a perfect example.
customer_reviews.author: Gator1pk

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've used it a few times already and so far it's holding up. I saw all the reviews talking about it bending, but it still has a decent rating so I figured I'd give it a shot. Now to me, even though it hasn't bent..yet.. It feels like it could, so I'll find out going into summer if it will or not. *Update* Just wanted to update my review and let you all know, I've busted many rusty bolts with this thing, so far no signs of bending or breaking and I trust it won't.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: And you’ll feel really cool too. I love this breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I have an opportunity to use this breaker bar, I smile very big. Anyone who needs to remove stubborn bolts and other fasteners, this will make life easier for you. And you’ll feel really cool too. I love this breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: I use this to tighten my lugs and it works great. It works great on break stubby bolts to, when I can use in open space.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Jashinski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This bar is very strong. I used it to release a nut that was tightened to at least 250 ft lbs. I have also purchased some other Tekton tools and am very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: C.P. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: but I LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a breaker bar before, but I LOVE this thing. Feels solid and well made like other TEKTON tools I have. EXTREMELY useful when working on a car, especially if (like me) you don't have an impact wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: Super-impressed with this breaker bar! It feels very solid and strong, and high quality. As soon as I took it out of the package I felt confident I made the right decision on getting this particular breaker bar, and could tell that it would be able to do what I bought it for. It looks a lot bigger in person than it does online, and provides plenty of leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Super ManTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cheap finish
customer_reviews.text: I've not used this yet, but the finish isn't up to par with the other Tekton tools I have. I know finish isn't everything but it seems that if a company cares about their product they also car how it's presented.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it too much but it has worked great breaking loose several stubborn lug nuts. Tool seems well made and chrome finish is nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Williams

customer_reviews.title: The 15" is a great size to give you more leverage than your typical ...
customer_reviews.text: The 15" is a great size to give you more leverage than your typical ratcheting wrench, but not too large to get into the smaller spaces. Heavy duty, and has stood up to a few uses with pipe cheater bars (do as I say and don't use them, not as I do, lol). Well built and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Solid breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid and I like the minimlism that goes with the head. Great quality product, as usual; it is Tekton after all. Most of my tools are Tekton and so far I haven't been let down.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: heres the scoop on this
customer_reviews.text: It removed the most stubborn almost seized lug nuts as i flip older rusty vehicles and for my needs its a godsend. This breaker bar is well made and will usually work well for you as it did for me. Now as for continuous use and lasting yrs? No way..you can call them throwaway breaker bars but for a lousy 25 bucks its sure worth it. Hey u might get one that does last a long time..
customer_reviews.author: Drewski

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this breaker bar on a daily basis working in industrial maintenance. I have put a lot of force on this bar several times, and so far it has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Why? Why why why?
customer_reviews.text: Why do manufacturers keep insisting on putting stickers with industrial strength glue. Why why why? This is what my brand new bar looks like after trying to peel, alcohol, acetone, sanding, and BURNING off to no avail. This is unacceptable. Attach a tag stop ruining brand new tools with useless f'n stickers!! The bar itself is very well made. It doesn;t feel like it will break at all. I bought it to replace the tiny stock lug bar that came with the car.
customer_reviews.author: RandPaul

customer_reviews.title: Need a lever long enough to move the world? This is it!
customer_reviews.text: Though quite long thus a separate - never tool box - tool, this thing is fantastic for those of us using manual tools. It is one of THE tools I now take out to the garage with me when thinking about wheel removal or any other torqued-down bolt...leverage works!
customer_reviews.author: justanothertechie

customer_reviews.title: I've been very pleased with the handful of Tekton tools I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: After using it the first time I was concerned about the head flexing since I was working on some stuck bolts. I suspected the design of the hinge would be weak. It held up very well breaking bolts that were torqued to 181lb-ft years ago. I've been very pleased with the handful of Tekton tools I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hoblit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for a better breaker bar at a better price! Removes (properly torqued) lug nuts with ease
customer_reviews.author: TechFine

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had This Years Ago.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is fantastic! Just enough "oomph" to get some cranky lug nuts off with. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ATS

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, mid-duty breaker
customer_reviews.text: size is good for easy usage. finish is excellent, weight is reassuring.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Durable breaker bar.
customer_reviews.text: Works to break thought nuts and bolts. Only wished there was slightly less play on the swivel head. May be a liable to break after repeated long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Weekender

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer :)
customer_reviews.text: Very handy, solid, and easy to work with breaker bar. Great tool if you can't get an impact to the bolt, and your ratchet handle is too small and don't want to ruin the ratchet internals with putting on a pipe and bust your knuckle open. Very happy so far with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Calza

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This breaker made short work of the front wheel bearing replacement. I removed the nut torqued to 220 ft/lbs with hardly any effort and did not have to use thread penetrant or heat or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: What a beast
customer_reviews.text: This is a real beast. It opened lug nuts like some small screws on computer motherboard. Highly recommended if you want to have tire changes with minimum to no efforts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great breaker bar. Free moving neck gets annoying
customer_reviews.text: Amazing breaker bar. Don’t be afraid to put any extra necessary force into it. Wish the neck was lockable
customer_reviews.author: shahmir

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Tekton 1/2 inch Drive and 24 inch long Breaker Bar and by comparing with the Neiko 00206A I did order a few weeks ago, noticed that the handle of this Breaker Bar is somehow thinner. Will see how these two tools will perform when needed. Otherwise and other than their thickness, they both look very much alike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 24-Inches is Perfect Length for Busting Loose Bolts
customer_reviews.text: No nonsense here. High quality tool from TEKTON at a super affordable price. 2 feet is long enough to get more torque and short enough to where it's not ridiculously long and hard to store. I recommend buying this with a set of sockets as well. I used it right out of the box to break loose some Strut Bolts and it performed beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: DJ TOGG

customer_reviews.title: I used this to easily break loose a 1 7/16 inch nut on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to easily break loose a 1 7/16 inch nut on my tractor rake. The rake part is supposed to rotate, but the nut was way too tight to allow the rotation. A little pull with this bar and the nut loosened up. Supplements my 1/2 inch breaker bar nicely
customer_reviews.author: jtx

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the oil plug opened at all, this made it super easy to open!
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Pulido

product_meta.title: TEKTON 15359 3/4-Inch Drive by 38-Inch Breaker Bar
product_meta.description: Size:3/4 in. Drive x 38 in.Fear no fastener with the monster muscle of the TEKTON 3/4 in. Drive x 38 in. Breaker Bar. With this kind of leverage, even the baddest bolts and nastiest nuts won’t slow you down. It’s like having a cheater bar built in! The high-torque, chrome moly, 180-degree flex head lets you work at any angle to get into tight spaces. A spring-loaded ball bearing retains sockets, preventing them from sticking on workpiece or being dropped. Made from high-quality forged and hardened chrome vanadium steel, this tough guy is built for a challenge and features a polished chrome plated finish that will protect and look great for years.
feature_bullets: Breaks loose rusted or stuck nuts and bolts
180-degree, chrome moly flex head lets you work at any angle
Forged and hardened chrome vanadium steel construction
Smoothly contoured, round profile handle for a comfortable grip

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,116 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
